customer_concentration.disclosure_notes: No single customer accounted for more than 10% of the Company’s consolidated net revenue during the fiscal years ended January 31, 2025, February 2, 2024, and February 3, 2023.

sources.name: Dell Technologies Delivers Fourth Quarter and Full-Year Fiscal 2025 Financial Results
Dell Form 10-K PDF / Investor presentation content

top_customers.notes: backlog cited ~$9B in slides; <10% of FY25 revenue
top_customers.name: xAI

segment_mix.notes: CSG consumer and commercial revenue lines are disclosed; government/public-sector not separately reported by Dell and is estimated below. Calculations use FY25 total revenue $95.6B (Exhibit 99.1).

customer_characteristics.geographic_notes: Approximately 60% of CSG revenue is generated in the Americas per the 10‑K; Dell sells globally across Americas, EMEA, and APJ and describes a global installed customer base including the world’s largest corporations down to SMBs and consumers.
customer_characteristics.typical_contract_length: DFS leases 2–4 years; fixed‑term loans generally 3–5 years; revolving loans repaid ~12 months on average.
customer_characteristics.recurring_vs_transactional: Dell defines recurring revenue to include maintenance, subscriptions, as‑a‑Service and operating leases. The company is pursuing growth in recurring revenue via Dell APEX and other consumption models. Historically, hardware product revenue is more transactional, while services, maintenance, financing and APEX subscriptions are recurring.

industry_exposure.notes: cited as a target vertical in 10‑K go‑to‑market description.
not disclosed but ISG growth and the cited ~$9B AI server backlog indicate material exposure in ISG.
